author: William Baldwin
title: Best ETFs: Short-Term Bonds
text:
Most of these ETFs are pretty safe, with fairly small exposure to run-ups in interest rates and, at least for the ones lending money to the U.S. Treasury, minimal credit risk.Alas, in a world of rate suppression, short-term bonds have tiny yields, often not even enough to compensate for inflation. Against miniscule real returns the cost of holding an ETF looms large. The cheapest of the bunch will cost you $135 to $200 per $10,000 invested over the course of a decade. That range is roughly triple what you pay on an efficient stock fund.The largest funds in this category: Vanguard Short-Term Bond ( BSV ), iShares 1-3 Year Treasury Bond ( SHY ) and iShares 1-3 Year Credit Bond ( CSJ ).Rules for the Best ETFs scorecard, and links to 13 categories of funds, can be found here .
